alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 11:54PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Haskell County through 1230 AM CST... At 1153 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sagerton, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Paint Creek around 1210 AM CST. Stamford and Lake Stamford Marina around 1215 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Jud, Us- 277 Near The Haskell-Knox County Line and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for west central Texas.
